page.title: 10 Fulham: description of area
page.content: This area could be said to form part of 'inner city' South West london. As such it has elements associated with inner city decay, inner city rehabilitation and inner city affluence. The South Bank river frontage of North Battersea and Wandsworth exemplifies the decline in important industry and the residential hinterland displays commenurate decay and re-develpment. Much re-development in this locality being in the form of tower block estates. Whilst the Fulham waterfront adjacent to the Wandsworth Bridge has similarities to that of Battersea, in the main, the north bank is markedly less industrial in aspect. Hurlingham Park and imposing, high priced apartment blocks are the dominant features. (continued on page 11)
